documents.title: Capitalization audit - [KR Inputs needed]
documents.content:
,

,Q1 capitalization audit

,Please follow the instructions below 

Step 1,Go to the tab of your respective alliance

Step 2,"Verify Column G - Finance/Portfolio Decision , for the final decision on Capitalisation of the KR."

,"If you want to challenge this decision, please change Column H - Do you want to challenge the decision? to Yes. Provide supporting commentary in Column I - Comment."

Step 3,Verify Column J - Check Questions to understand which question you need to answer:

,A - Provide evidence this KR results in the creation of assets in Column I - Comment.

,"B - Check column L - B. Does the KR result in economic benefit?

If the cell is highlighted with ‚ÄòOops, there is no YP strategy provided for this KR‚Äô  you need to provide the YP/QAR strategy this KR is associated with on the OKR Management Tool - Column AP (Input - Tech Strategy) or you need to explain why this KR is associated with a strategy with an economic benefit.

If the cell is highlighted with ‚ÄòThis KR is associated with KTLO but we believe it delivers benefit and results in the creation of assets. Please advise',  you need to help us map this KR to an economic benefit.

If the cell is highlighted with ‚ÄòKR not found on the OKR Tool‚Äô, please help us map days reported to another KR."

,"C - Change value in column M - C. Percentage of work reported in cap activities YTD that is actually capitalisable if the KR is set to not meet or canceled, if it is partially capitalisable, or if there is need to ensure teams are not reporting non-capitalisable activities.

You can also use this column to correct the number of capitalisable days if there were mistakes in the reporting during the previous months (see FAQ 3 for more details)."

,"If the column is ‚Äú-‚Äù there are no open question to address and if there are more than one item (i.e. B, C) please address both questions."

,

2025 - Capitalisation Reporting,Please refer to the document for more information on this exercise and FAQs


============================================================
## EMAIL CONTENTS
============================================================

### EMAIL: Notes: ‚ÄúHamed:Nikita 1:1‚Äù Dec 18, 2025
ID: 19b326cb629e24f1
From: Gemini <gemini-notes@google.com>
----------------------------------------

Notes from ‚ÄúHamed:Nikita 1:1‚Äù



These notes have been sent to invited guests in your organization.



Open meeting notes



The content was auto-generated on December 18, 2025, 6:04 PM CET and may  

contain errors.





Summary



Hamed Karimian and Nikita Gorshkov discussed redesigning the product detail  

page (PDP) to ensure key components like "subscribe and save" and "onetime  

purchase" are visible above the fold by reducing element size and  

repositioning items; Nikita Gorshkov stressed confirming the visible frame  

size with Michael. The participants addressed the need for image  

consistency across PDPs and debated adopting a more creative,  

lifestyle-oriented approach to imagery, similar to Apple's design, rather  

than the current functional e-commerce carousel, with Hamed Karimian  

agreeing to explore more creative PDP ideas with Michael. Nikita Gorshkov  

challenged the existing feasibility constraints, encouraging boldness, and  

recommended involving engineers early in creative discussions to facilitate  

the implementation of new ideas.





Suggested next steps





Hamed Karimian will work with Michael to ensure the design changes allow  

all important details to be shown in the default view without scrolling.



Nikita Gorshkov will send Hamed Karimian the URL that was discussed.



Hamed Karimian will work with Michael to explore more creative, less  

e-commercy ideas for the PDP page, and include engineers in those  

discussions.





Meeting records Document Notes by Gemini

Google LLC, 1600 Ampitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA

### EMAIL: Zoom meetings just got even more AI focused
ID: 19b323a9b774fc8e
From: Mindstream <hello@mindstream.news>
----------------------------------------

----------

The Moon isn‚Äôt changing, you are.



Head to the Southern Hemisphere, and the Moon appears upside down compared to how it looks in the Northern Hemisphere. 



The famous ‚ÄúMan in the Moon‚Äù? Down there, he flips into a rabbit.



Same Moon, different audience angle.



**What‚Äôs in store:**



* **Zoom **is coming for your entire workday.



* This is how **Disney **plans to deal with AI.



* **Mindstream Picks: **LG will launch its first Micro RGB flagship TV in 2026.



_Read Time: 4 minutes_





--------------------

###### **ZOOM**



## [The meeting ended. But Zoom didn‚Äôt](https://news.zoom.com/zoom-launches-ai-companion-3-0/)



View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/b4ba3dd3-4166-40c7-8ff4-74cd1860e64f/mindstreammg_Create_a_digital_illustration_in_a_clean_modern__a5d15fa8-757e-4c86-847f-df463ec3a363_2.png?t=1765889476)

Follow image link: (https://news.zoom.com/zoom-launches-ai-companion-3-0/)

Caption: 



Zoom has [announced](https://news.zoom.com/zoom-launches-ai-companion-3-0/) AI Companion 3.0, an update to its AI assistant as the company continues to expand beyond video meetings. 



The release adds AI-powered personal workflows (in beta), new features coming to Zoom Docs, and a redesigned web interface aimed at helping users organise work and manage follow-ups more easily.



AI Companion 3.0 runs on Zoom‚Äôs federated AI setup, [combining](https://markets.business



---------

## **‚ÄúWould you use an AI assistant while reading a book?‚Äù**



**Yes, it sounds useful - 59% **‚úÖ



No, I want to read alone - 41%



**Your Views:**



_‚ÄúHaving an AI assistant for any task is always useful - it‚Äôs gonna be the new normal! ask me I am a developer :D‚Äù _- **_jano health_**



_‚ÄúTrue wisdom comes from 3 or more perspectives. I'd like that added to the authors and my reading to understand more!‚Äù -_**_ raatime_**



_‚ÄúIf I was taking a class to interpret and analyze literature, the feature might be useful.‚Äù _**_- _****eschrag**



Submit your opinions in our polls to be featured!





----------**Number Crunch Answer: **_1/3._** **



**#932.**

Maybe I should start linking these together?



‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî



‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî





‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

### EMAIL: Notes: ‚ÄúInfluencer MP: EOY Review‚Äù Dec 18, 2025
ID: 19b323510de26f80
From: Gemini <gemini-notes@google.com>
----------------------------------------

Notes from ‚ÄúInfluencer MP: EOY Review‚Äù



These notes have been sent to invited guests in your organization.



Open meeting notes



The content was auto-generated on December 18, 2025, 5:03 PM CET and may  

contain errors.





Summary



Annette MvdE welcomed the team, including Katheryn Eckles, Sameer Doda,  

Nikita Gorshkov, and Marc, to review last year's research and plan for next  

year, focusing on ongoing customer and creator interviews. Katheryn Eckles  

shared that influencer interviews revealed positive creator interest, but  

strong demand for clear monetization structure, efficient low-effort recipe  

uploads (eg, automated nutrition facts), and enhanced filtering options on  

creator profiles, with concerns raised about the potential cost and time  

impact of the vetting process. Customer interviews showed high enthusiasm  

for the marketplace concept and a preference for low-commitment purchase  

models, emphasizing the need for creator trust established through verified  

badges, transparent reviews, and links to original social media videos.  

Someone in Megan Thee Scallion (Canada - Toronto HQ, 2) proposed  

integrating vetted creator recipes into HelloFresh's active meal selection  

for existing subscribers, suggesting that creators be paid every time their  

recipe ships, while Sameer Doda provided updates on scoping the MVP for the  

one-time purchase experience, leading to a recognized challenge regarding  

the sequencing of customer-facing versus creator-facing capabilities due to  

the supply-driven nature of the platform.





Suggested next steps





Katheryn Eckles will bring up the question about the format of the recipes  

in the final interview.



Sameer Doda will make changes and updates to the customer journey document,  

organize more sessions to gather insights, and present the end-to-end  

customer journey for the one-time purchase experience in the next session.



Sameer Doda will share updates on the scope of the MVP after the holidays.



Annette MvdE will add vacation dates to the shared document.





Meeting records Document Notes by Gemini

### EMAIL: Accessibility-2025 Program. Final Word
ID: 19b3214694a84d56
From: Roman Kovalevsky <roman.kovalevsky@hellofresh.com>
----------------------------------------

Why accessibility was prioritized



Prioritizing accessibility in our apps allows us to reach 1 in 4 adults in

the US <https://www.cdc.gov/media/releases/2024/s0716-Adult-disability.html>

and capture a share of the $140 billion

<https://www.nascio.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/NASCIO_The-Economic-Case-for-Digital-Accessibility_2025_a11y.pdf>

that Americans with disabilities spend annually on food and groceries

<https://www.ers.usda.gov/data-products/chart-gallery/chart-detail?chartId=76967>.

A good interface pays back with higher conversions.





Besides that, the European Accessibility Act (EAA), which mandates that

websites and mobile applications comply with the WCAG 2.2 Level AA

standard, came into effect on June 28, 2025. The directive applies to all

businesses in the EU, including HelloFresh and Factor. Non-compliance can

result in penalties such as fines (up to ‚Ç¨500K) or, in some countries like

Ireland, even 18 months of prison sentences.



As a reaction to a new law, HelloTech Objective #4

<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YCKnWvWNLNEI3FgtIUuBFaLK7ZXqOfnGAdP4R72JxaQ/edit?tab=t.0#bookmark=id.fznoddvvfahg>

and a follow-up Accessibility-2025 Program

<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1LwrtHRYx5pqta9k7dqKHJBfnwQOD5RH637JcxaA4tLY/edit?pli=1&gid=1881360676#gid=1881360676>

were formed.



The program had 2 goals:



Goal



Did we achieve it?



Reduce the number of "important" Accessibility issues in HelloFresh,

GreenChef, and Factor by 90% in WE



chter 

(Vorsitzender), Thomas W. Griesel, Fabien Simon, Edward Boyes |¬†

Vorsitzender des Aufsichtsrats: John H. Rittenhouse¬†| Eingetragen beim 

Amtsgericht Charlottenburg, HRB 182382 B | USt-Id Nr.: DE 302210417

### EMAIL: Notes: ‚ÄúNikita Gorshkov - Appt Booking (Gabriel Greg√≥rio (Senior Product Analyst))‚Äù Dec 18, 2025
ID: 19b31fa12aa9b6f1
From: Gemini <gemini-notes@google.com>
----------------------------------------

Notes from ‚ÄúNikita Gorshkov - Appt Booking (Gabriel Greg√≥rio (Senior  

Product Analyst))‚Äù



These notes have been sent to invited guests in your organization.



Open meeting notes



The content was auto-generated on December 18, 2025, 3:59 PM CET and may  

contain errors.





Summary



Gabriel Greg√≥rio shared their prior work in data visualization for a  

wellness company, explaining how they shifted to providing data insights,  

such as localized user activity metrics around gyms, which significantly  

enhanced the sales team's negotiation capabilities. Addressing Nikita  

Gorshkov's query about shortening time to market and running parallel  

experiments, Gabriel Greg√≥rio suggested incorporating faster research  

methods like social media surveys or third-party small-group testing  

alongside traditional A/B testing, citing an example of using two-way  

messaging for payment reminders at a bank. Gabriel Greg√≥rio also offered  

region-specific qualitative methods for Brazil, like in-app surveys with  

discounts, and quantitative methods, such as engaging campaigns or  

competitions to gather measurable data on potential new users and order  

frequency, while Nikita Gorshkov clarified that their company is globally  

hiring for an analytics role and has not yet expanded to Brazil due to  

requirements around "meat culture," pricing, and infrastructure, though the  

market is considered interesting.





Suggested next steps





Nikita Gorshkov will provide the feedback to the global talent agency today.





Meeting records Document Notes by Gemini

### EMAIL: Notes: ‚ÄúAI Bytes Assemble‚Äù Dec 18, 2025
ID: 19b3191bb33800c5
From: Gemini <gemini-notes@google.com>
----------------------------------------

Notes from ‚ÄúAI Bytes Assemble‚Äù



These notes have been sent to invited guests in your organization.



Open meeting notes



The content was auto-generated on December 18, 2025, 2:04 PM CET and may  

contain errors.





Summary



The participants, including Adam Ghanem, someone in BER - P89-L4-Dim Sum  

(Berlin Campus - Prinzenstra√üe, L4), Pepijn Senders, Lobo Olsson, and Mario  

Konschake (mentioned in collaboration), discussed aligning on expectations,  

group boundaries, and the core focus of integrating GenAI into the  

end-to-end software development lifecycle, specifically for acceleration  

and platform team initiatives like React Native migration and accessibility  

efforts. Someone in BER - P89-L4-Dim Sum (Berlin Campus - Prinzenstra√üe,  

L4) and Pepijn Senders agreed that the immediate focus should be on small,  

high-value automatable pieces, particularly improving the design system  

check to ensure Figma files are "Zestifiable," and packaging solutions for  

the handover stage within Spec Machine. The participants also aligned on  

conducting a pilot with customer-facing teams, treating the onboarding  

process as a scientific experiment, and agreed on the necessity of sitting  

together to review the list of teams and defined quality parameters.





Suggested next steps





Someone in BER - P89-L4-Dim Sum (Berlin Campus - Prinzenstra√üe, L4) will  

talk to Kudlo to hand over these things.



Someone in BER - P89-L4-Dim Sum (Berlin Campus - Pri





define the success criteria for simplifying the handover from designs.



Someone in BER - P89-L4-Dim Sum (Berlin Campus - Prinzenstra√üe, L4) will  

get Luigi to work with the DA team, using the closed commands available, to  

track usage and collect input and learnings.



Someone in BER - P89-L4-Dim Sum (Berlin Campus - Prinzenstra√üe, L4) will  

include a way to collect feedback from the users of spec machine to  

understand what is needed for collaboration next.



Someone in BER - P89-L4-Dim Sum (Berlin Campus - Prinzenstra√üe, L4), Pepijn  

Senders, Mario Konschake, and Lobo Olsson will collaborate later on to put  

the missing pieces into the pipeline from discovery to deployment.

A Playful Wrap-Up of 2025



(and some very competitive gingerbread)



As the year comes to an end, we wanted to do three things:



1. Say thank you (because none of this happens without you)



2. A 2025 recap, a few numbers we‚Äôre proud of and a small humble brag üòå



3. Crown our official Christmas Champion üèÜ



Scaling play - Globally üöÄ



This year marked a clear shift for Flarie.



In 2025, 5.3M+ players engaged with branded games built by our customers - a 352% increase compared to last year.



Those games reached players across 15 countries and 5 continents, meaning that at almost any moment, someone somewhere was playing a Flarie-powered game.



From early mornings in Europe to lunch breaks in North America and evenings in the Middle East - play fit right in.



People don‚Äôt just click - they stay and
